column1: #FORMAT=WebAnno TSV 3.3
#T_SP=webanno.custom.RoleAnnotation|roles
#Text=Mr.
#Text=Fedotov: Several tragedies took place\r
#Text=yesterday: the cowardly assassination of the Russian\r
#Text=Ambassador to Turkey and the despicable terrorist\r
#Text=attack in Berlin.
#Text=May I express, on behalf of the United\r
#Text=Nations Office on Drugs and Crime (UNODC), my\r
#Text=deepest condolences to the Governments of the Russian\r
#Text=Federation and Germany and to the families of the\r
#Text=victims.
#Text=As the UNODC mandate includes counter-\r
#Text=terrorism, we stand ready to increase our support to\r
#Text=Member States to strengthen international solidarity\r
#Text=and cooperation in fighting the scourge of terrorism\r
#Text=and hatred.
#Text=Turning to the agenda item under consideration,\r
#Text=allow me to begin by expressing my gratitude to the\r
#Text=Security Council for its attention to this urgent issue.
#Text=Indeed, this is a historic meeting of the Security\r
#Text=Council, as the Council is set to adopt, for the first time\r
#Text=in its history, an action-oriented resolution dedicated to\r
#Text=human trafficking.
#Text=I would also like to thank UNODC\r
#Text=Goodwill Ambassador Nadia Murad for helping to raise\r
#Text=awareness of the plight of trafficking victims.
#Text=Thanks to these efforts, heightened attention is\r
#Text=being given to the problem of human trafficking in\r
#Text=conflict and mass movements of refugees and migrants,\r
#Text=where we have seen this terrible crime acquire ever\r
#Text=more appalling dimensions.
#Text=In seeking to strengthen international responses, we\r
#Text=must keep in sharp focus the fact that human trafficking\r
#Text=is pervasive.
#Text=It is transnational, and its victims are\r
#Text=everywhere.
#Text=Trafficking victims have been detected in\r
#Text=106 countries and territories around the world.
#Text=Building effective action thus requires a strong\r
#Text=framework of international cooperation and shared\r
#Text=responsibility.
#Text=I deliberately use the word "build", as\r
#Text=there is no single measure, no one step in any given part\r
#Text=of the world that can address this problem alone.
#Text=The building blocks we need can be found in the\r
#Text=United Nations Convention against Transnational\r
#Text=Organized Crime and its Protocol to Prevent, Suppress\r
#Text=and Punish Trafficking in Persons, Especially Women\r
#Text=and Children.
#Text=This international treaty, concluded\r
#Text=more than a decade ago, is still young, but some 158\r
#Text=countries have now criminalized most forms of human\r
#Text=trafficking in their domestic laws, in line with the\r
#Text=Protocol.
#Text=It is true that the full implementation of the\r
#Text=Protocol's provisions has yet to be achieved.
#Text=However,\r
#Text=the Palermo Convention and the Protocol could serve as\r
#Text=a platform for a vast collective response to many of the\r
#Text=challenges raised by today's debate.
#Text=What we really need is to strengthen existing\r
#Text=frameworks, which represent a solid foundation of\r
#Text=international law and years of painstaking operational\r
#Text=cooperation that we can build upon to act against\r
#Text=modern-day slave traders, including in situations\r
#Text=of conflict and wherever we find such activities\r
#Text=taking place.
#Text=The report of the Secretary-General (S/2016/949)\r
#Text=details the efforts of the United Nations system to\r
#Text=support Member States in improving the implementation\r
#Text=of this international law instrument.
#Text=Tomorrow UNODC will present its 2016 Global\r
#Text=Report on Trafficking in Persons, which it is mandated\r
#Text=to do by the General Assembly and which provides\r
#Text=a snapshot of the state of national responses to the\r
#Text=challenges of human trafficking.
#Text=The report, based\r
#Text=on reliable data and information provided by Member\r
#Text=States, establishes that an increasing number of\r
#Text=trafficking victims from conflict-affected countries\r
#Text=such as Syria, Iraq and Somalia have been detected\r
#Text=in Europe, Asia and the Middle East.
#Text=The report also\r
#Text=features a thematic chapter on the connections between\r
#Text=conflict, migration and trafficking.
#Text=I hope that all\r
#Text=present will join us tomorrow at the launch.
#Text=Looking ahead, I would like to highlight the urgent\r
#Text=need for countries to improve identification and referral\r
#Text=processes tailored to the challenges of conflict zones\r
#Text=and mass movements.
#Text=UNODC is helping countries to enhance the\r
#Text=identification and protection of trafficking victims\r
#Text=among refugees and displaced persons fleeing conflict\r
#Text=in the Middle East and Africa, and we hope to expand\r
#Text=this work in future.
#Text=At the same time, strategic law-\r
#Text=enforcement action must target upstream organized\r
#Text=criminals through intelligence-sharing,joint operations,\r
#Text=financial investigations and coordination within and\r
#Text=across borders.
#Text=The full arsenal of tools that we have to disrupt\r
#Text=organized crime networks and terrorist groups and to\r
#Text=fight money laundering and counter-terrorism financing\r
#Text=must be deployed.
#Text=Criminals exploit weakness.
#Text=Gaps\r
#Text=in our responses abet impunity and leave defenceless\r
#Text=people exposed.
#Text=UNODC is committed to doing our\r
#Text=part to support the Security Council, to integrate\r
#Text=action against human trafficking, to promote justice\r
#Text=and accountability, and to protect the victimized\r
#Text=and vulnerable.
